utterances.speaker: rep
utterances.text: Hi Nina, thanks for hopping on. I saw you downloaded our attribution benchmarking report last week. What caught your eye?

utterances.speaker: prospect_head_of_data
utterances.text: Yeah, the section on multi-touch attribution gaps was exactly what we're wrestling with. We're a 60-person shop doing analytics consulting, and our own marketing attribution is embarrassingly bad.

utterances.speaker: rep
utterances.text: Ha, the cobbler's children have no shoes. That's actually more common than you'd think with analytics firms. Tell me more about what you're seeing.

utterances.speaker: prospect_head_of_data
utterances.text: We're running campaigns across LinkedIn, Google, our podcast sponsorships, and a bunch of partner co-marketing stuff. Right now we're stitching everything together in spreadsheets. My analyst spends probably two days a month just building the attribution report, and honestly, I don't trust the numbers.

utterances.speaker: rep
utterances.text: Two days a month on manual attribution. And you said you don't trust the output. What breaks down specifically?

utterances.speaker: prospect_head_of_data
utterances.text: The big one is we can't track the podcast-to-website-to-demo-request journey. People hear us on a podcast, Google us a week later, and we attribute it all to organic search. We know the podcasts are working because prospects mention them on calls, but the data doesn't show it.

utterances.speaker: rep
utterances.text: That's a classic dark funnel problem. The offline-to-online handoff is where most attribution models fall apart. How much are you spending annually on those podcast sponsorships?

utterances.speaker: prospect_head_of_data
utterances.text: About 180K a year. And our CEO keeps asking me whether we should double down or kill them. I can't give her a straight answer with the data I have.

utterances.speaker: rep
utterances.text: So you have a 180K spending decision that's essentially flying blind. That's actually a perfect use case for us. Our self-reported attribution module captures that exact journey. When someone books a demo, they get a 'how did you hear about us' field that ties back into the attribution model alongside the digital touchpoints.

utterances.speaker: prospect_head_of_data
utterances.text: We've tried the how-did-you-hear-about-us thing manually. The data quality was terrible. People just pick the first option.

utterances.speaker: rep
utterances.text: Totally. The trick is in how you present it and how you weight it. We use a free-text field instead of a dropdown, then use NLP to categorize and cross-reference with digital touchpoint data. Clients typically see 70 to 80% match rates between self-reported and digital signals.

utterances.speaker: prospect_head_of_data
utterances.text: That's clever. Okay, what does something like this cost for a company our size? We're not a big budget operation.

utterances.speaker: rep
utterances.text: For your team size and channel mix, you'd be looking at our Starter tier. That's 42K annually, which includes the core attribution engine, the self-reported module, and integrations with your ad platforms and CRM.

utterances.speaker: prospect_head_of_data
utterances.text: 42K. That's not nothing, but if it saves my analyst two days a month and helps us make a smarter call on 180K in podcast spend, the math works pretty quickly.

utterances.speaker: rep
utterances.text: Exactly. And that analyst time is probably the smaller piece. The real value is having confidence in your channel allocation decisions. If podcasts are actually driving 30% of your pipeline but your current data says 5%, that changes your entire strategy.

utterances.speaker: prospect_head_of_data
utterances.text: Right. Okay, what does implementation look like? We run HubSpot and Google Ads primarily.

utterances.speaker: rep
utterances.text: HubSpot integration is native, takes about two days to set up. Google Ads is also plug-and-play. For your LinkedIn campaigns we'd use a UTM-based connector. Most SMB clients are up and running in three to four weeks.

utterances.speaker: prospect_head_of_data
utterances.text: Three to four weeks is fast. Do we need engineering resources or can my marketing ops person handle it?

utterances.speaker: rep
utterances.text: Marketing ops can handle the whole thing. The HubSpot integration is a one-click OAuth connection. We handle the data pipeline setup on our end.

utterances.speaker: prospect_head_of_data
utterances.text: That's really important to us. We don't have spare engineering cycles. What about data we've already collected? Can we do any historical attribution or is it forward-looking only?

utterances.speaker: rep
utterances.text: We can ingest up to 12 months of historical data from HubSpot and your ad platforms. So you'd actually get some retroactive attribution models to validate against what you're seeing anecdotally with podcasts.

utterances.speaker: prospect_head_of_data
utterances.text: Oh that's great. That would let us test the accuracy before we commit to changing our budget allocation. I'm pretty sold on this honestly. What would next steps look like if we wanted to move forward?

utterances.speaker: rep
utterances.text: I can send over a proposal today. It would be a standard annual agreement at 42K with quarterly billing. If you sign this week, we could kick off implementation next Monday and have you live by end of March.

utterances.speaker: prospect_head_of_data
utterances.text: I need to loop in our CEO, Alisha, but I'm going to recommend we do this. Can you include some case studies from other analytics or consulting firms? That'll help me make the case internally.

utterances.speaker: rep
utterances.text: Absolutely. I have two great case studies from similar-sized consulting firms. I'll package those with the proposal. Would it be helpful to have a short call with Alisha as well, or do you think you can handle it internally?

utterances.speaker: prospect_head_of_data
utterances.text: I think I can handle it. She trusts my judgment on data tooling. If she has questions I'll pull you in, but honestly this should be straightforward. Send me that proposal and I'll aim to have an answer by Friday.

utterances.speaker: rep
utterances.text: Sounds great, Nina. I'll have everything in your inbox by end of day. Looking forward to getting you off those spreadsheets.

utterances.speaker: prospect_head_of_data
utterances.text: Ha, you and me both. Thanks for the walkthrough, this was really helpful.
